statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Paul Pierce scored nine of his 26 points in overtime and Antoine Walker added 17 and 15 rebounds as the Boston Celtics extended their winning streak to six games with a 109-102 victory over the Phoenix Suns.
article.headline: Pierce scores nine in OT, Celts pull away

images.name: Pierce, Paul 011207 inline
images.caption: Paul Pierce celebrates Antoine Walker's game-tying tip-in. Pierce took over in OT with nine points.

article.linkText: Walker's tip, Pierce's points carry Celtics to sixth straight win
article.story:
BOSTON (AP) -- Paul Pierce waited and waited to go back into the game. When he finally got the call, he made up for lost time. Pierce scored 26 points, including eight in overtime, and Eric Williams added a season-high 17 as the Boston Celtics won their sixth straight game, 109-102 over the Phoenix Suns on Friday night. "It was like having new life," said Pierce, who missed more than 12 minutes in the second half after picking up his fourth foul. "Like coming back from the dead." Boston has come back from years of frustation and has jumped out to an 11-6 record. The winning streak is the longest for the Celtics since they won six consecutive games from Jan. 23-Feb. 4. The last time the team won seven straight was 1994. Phoenix dropped its second game in a row and hasn't won in Boston since 1997. Antoine Walker, who had struggled all game, tipped in Pierce's miss as time expired to send the game into overtime. "That was really a big tip-in by Antoine Walker," said Phoenix guard Stephon Marbury. "We had the game, but it's never over 'til it's over. They made their free throws down the stretch and we just didn't convert." The Suns took a 94-92 lead in the extra period, but Boston answered with the next six points, the final two coming on Pierce's uncontested dunk through the lane. "Our team showed a lot of heart down the stretch," added Pierce. "But I gotta thank Antoine. He really saved me and got us a great win." Marbury hit one of two free throws before Pierce's 3-pointer from the left side gave the Celtics a 101-95 advantage with 2:14 left. Pierce hit one foul shot and Milt Palacio sank a pair to give Boston a nine-point lead with 52 seconds remaining. Boston moved five games over the .500 mark for the first time since 1991-92, Larry Bird's final season with the Celtics. "It was a great victory for us and a very exciting game," said Celtics coach Jim O'Brien. "We beat a good basketball team. We rely on Paul and Antoine to step up when the game is on the line and they don't disappoint often." The Suns were led by Marbury's 24 points. Tony Delk added a season-high 20 points while Rodney Rogers and Shawn Marion each finished with 17. Marion missed a 3-pointer with 17 seconds left in regulation and Walker grabbed the rebound and called timeout. Pierce's 18-footer from the left side was off the mark, but Walker tipped it in as time expired. Walker was held to just 17 points on 7-of-22 shooting. He also grabbed 15 rebounds. Tony Battie added a season-high 14 points for Boston.

Game notes
Celtics backup point guard Randy Brown, who was activated Wednesday after spending the first 15 games on the injured list, went back on after re-aggravating his groin in practice on Thursday. Walter McCarty was activated after spending the last five games on the IL with a sprained left toe. ... Boston had held its last eight opponents under 100 points. ... Pierce entered the game leading the league in scoring at 27.6 points per game. ... The Suns were swept by the Celtics last season for the first time since the 1987-88 campaign. ... Phoenix starting center Jake Tsakalidis left the game with 8:34 left in the third quarter with a injury to his left arm. He was undercut by Walker and did not return to the game.
